heisig_chinese_memo: I bound up ten thousand dollars and hid it under the floor.
heisig_constituent: ten thousand, one, ceiling, bound up
heisig_story: Japanese counts higher numbers in units of ten thousand, unlike the West, which advances according to units of one thousand. (Thus, for instance, 40,000 would be read "four ten-thousands" by a Japanese.) Given that the comma is used in larger numbers to bind up a numerical unit of one thousand, the elements for one and bound up naturally come to form ten thousand. The order of strokes here needs special attention, both because it falls outside the general principles we have learned already, and because it involves writing the element for bound up in an order opposite to the one we learned. If it is any consolation, this exception is consistent every time these three strokes come together.
koohiiStory1: I bound ten thousand dollars together and hid it under the floor.
koohiiStory2: We have "one" at the top and if you turn the kanji 90 degrees you will see arabic 4 shich means it has four zeros in front of it!

origin_of_ch_char_book: (è¬, ä¸‡, wan, ten thousand) is the shape of scorpion . The tail of this character shows a hook with three swords (trident): (ä¹, jiu, nine). In ancient times, people often ate large numbers of scorpions that they cooked, skewered on a stick. Now it means the number 10,000. This could be also due to scorpionâ€™s characteristics of living in groups and laying many eggs.
humanum_full_description_en:
today generally regarded " Wan " word considered " Wan simplified" characters, though this statement is correct, but it is not comprehensive. Because the word " wan " is very old, it has been used as a family name earlier than in inscriptions, but its shape has not yet been determined. "Ji Yun": "Wan Tu Fu surname. Tu sound Qi, now read Mu Qi" this interpretation may be a trace of this usage.

In addition, according to Qu Wanli, Qiu Xigui and others, the original meaning of " 10,000 " should refer to some "10,000 people" engaged in dance and music work. "A" 1585: "Almost (call) Wanwu (dance)", which means ordering ten thousand people to dance. The word " wan " is related to this usage of dancing, which is found in ancient books and is written as " wan ". "Wan Wu" is the ancient dance name. First it is Wu Wu, where the dancers hold weapons; then, there is Wen Wu where the dancers hold toba and musical instruments. "poetry. Bei Feng. "Jane Xi": "Fang Jiang Wan Dance", "Gong Ting Wan Dance". Linyi Guang pointed out that " Wan " is " hideaway " archaic, A bronze inscription " Bin " from the word " Wan " ( " hideaway ") sound.

However, because the ancient sounds of " ten thousand " and " ten thousand " were similar, they were already borrowed as thousands of " ten thousand." However, we should point out that the ten thousand meanings of " ten thousand " are actually the " ten thousand " of scorpion borrowed from the original interpretation. It can be seen from this that pure homophonic borrowing (the so-called rebus in the West) does not pay attention to the original meaning of the word borrowed. Therefore, the thousands of " wan " borrowed from the scorpion " wan " or borrowed from the original " wan " to explain the 10,000 people. It doesn't matter at all. The Chinese character "Yijian" plan simplified " wan " to " wan ". Although it is difficult to understand from the shape of the character, it can be traced from the historical source. Because by " Wan " as " Wan " As far back as the Shang Dynasty in addition to the inscriptions, the six countries of ancient Indian Spring and Autumn Period "ten million" of " Wan " make more " Wan ." In 2001, the cultural relics of the Leifeng Pagoda Palace in Hangzhou City, Zhejiang Province were unearthed. Among them, the central part of the "silver gilt hollowed out mandarin duck and geese pattern cushion" from the Five Dynasties period and the "gilt gold and silver box" unearthed at the same time have the "Long Live the Autumn" on the lid. The four-character; and it is handed down that you can still find the Liao dynasty play money with "Long live the thousand years". All of these can be used as evidence that the word " 10,000 " has been ancient and still used.

Heisig constituents: ten thousand, one, ceiling, bound up
Heisig: Japanese counts higher numbers in units of ten thousand, unlike the West, which advances according to units of one thousand. (Thus, for instance, 40,000 would be read "four ten-thousands" by a Japanese.) Given that the comma is used in larger numbers to bind up a numerical unit of one thousand, the elements for one and bound up naturally come to form ten thousand. The order of strokes here needs special attention, both because it falls outside the general principles we have learned already, and because it involves writing the element for bound up in an order opposite to the one we learned. If it is any consolation, this exception is consistent every time these three strokes come together.

Meaning Mnemonic
You cut the leaf with your sword into ten thousand pieces!
If you can get to ten thousand different pieces, then that means your sword is absolutely perfect. If your sword dulls before you get to ten thousand, you have to throw it away.
